questiontext.text:
Consider a Cantilever beam as shown in the image above.

The wall generates a reaction force, R, at positon A (x=0) and an anticlockwise moment, M.

There is a single Uniformly distributed load acting between positions B and C as shown.

Using the convention that upward forces (vertical),forces to the right (horizontal) and anti-clockwise moments are positive, and the information given:

a) Calculate the magnitude of the reaction force R and the moment M to the nearest whole number.

R = {1:NUMERICAL:=370:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

M = {1:NUMERICAL:=222:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

b) Calculate and draw the Shear Force Diagram (SFD) on paper and identify the following values:

Shear Force just to the right of A.

{1:NUMERICAL:=370:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

Shear Force just to the right of B.

{1:NUMERICAL:=370:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

Shear Force just to the right of C.

{1:NUMERICAL:= 0:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

Shear Force just to the right of D.

{1:NUMERICAL:= 0:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

From the drop down menus below indicate how the indicated points are connected in the SFD

1) A and B {1:MULTICHOICE:~=Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A line with a slope.~A curve}

2) B and C {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~=A line with a slope.~A curve}

3) C and D {1:MULTICHOICE:=Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A line with a slope.~A curve}

c) Calculate and draw the Bending Moment Diagram (BMD) on paper and identify the following values:

Bending moment at A.

{1:NUMERICAL:=-222:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

Bending Moment at B.

{1:NUMERICAL:=-111:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

Bending Moment at C.

{1:NUMERICAL:= 0:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

Bending Moment at D.

{1:NUMERICAL:= 0:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

From the drop down menus below indicate how the indicated points are connected in the BMD

1) A and B {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~=A line with a slope.~A curve}

2) B and C {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A line with a slope.~=A curve}

3) C and D {1:MULTICHOICE:=Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A line with a slope.~A curve}

The wall generates a reaction force, R, at positon A (x=0) and an anticlockwise moment, M.

There is a single Uniformly distributed load acting between positions B and C as shown.

Using the convention that upward forces (vertical),forces to the right (horizontal) and anti-clockwise moments are positive, and the information given:

a) Calculate the magnitude of the reaction force R and the moment M to the nearest whole number.

R = {1:NUMERICAL:=360:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

M = {1:NUMERICAL:=198:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

b) Calculate and draw the Shear Force Diagram (SFD) on paper and identify the following values:

Shear Force just to the right of A.

{1:NUMERICAL:=360:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

Shear Force just to the right of B.

{1:NUMERICAL:=360:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

Shear Force just to the right of C.

{1:NUMERICAL:= 0:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

Shear Force just to the right of D.

{1:NUMERICAL:= 0:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

From the drop down menus below indicate how the indicated points are connected in the SFD

1) A and B {1:MULTICHOICE:~=Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A line with a slope.~A curve}

2) B and C {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~=A line with a slope.~A curve}

3) C and D {1:MULTICHOICE:=Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A line with a slope.~A curve}

c) Calculate and draw the Bending Moment Diagram (BMD) on paper and identify the following values:

Bending moment at A.

{1:NUMERICAL:=-198:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

Bending Moment at B.

{1:NUMERICAL:=-54:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

Bending Moment at C.

{1:NUMERICAL:= 0:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

Bending Moment at D.

{1:NUMERICAL:= 0:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

From the drop down menus below indicate how the indicated points are connected in the BMD

1) A and B {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~=A line with a slope.~A curve}

2) B and C {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A line with a slope.~=A curve}

3) C and D {1:MULTICHOICE:=Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A line with a slope.~A curve}

Distributed loads are equivalent to point loads acting at the midpoint of the distributed load.

Your Shear Force Diagram should look like the image shown above.

Your Bending Moment Diagram should look like the image shown above. It is the integral of the SFD

The wall generates a reaction force, R, at positon A (x=0) and an anticlockwise moment, M.

There is a single Uniformly distributed load acting between positions B and C as shown.

Using the convention that upward forces (vertical),forces to the right (horizontal) and anti-clockwise moments are positive, and the information given:

a) Calculate the magnitude of the reaction force R and the moment M to the nearest whole number.

R = {1:NUMERICAL:=490:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

M = {1:NUMERICAL:=270:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

b) Calculate and draw the Shear Force Diagram (SFD) on paper and identify the following values:

Shear Force just to the right of A.

{1:NUMERICAL:=490:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

Shear Force just to the right of B.

{1:NUMERICAL:=490:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

Shear Force just to the right of C.

{1:NUMERICAL:= 0:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

Shear Force just to the right of D.

{1:NUMERICAL:= 0:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

From the drop down menus below indicate how the indicated points are connected in the SFD

1) A and B {1:MULTICHOICE:~=Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A line with a slope.~A curve}

2) B and C {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~=A line with a slope.~A curve}

3) C and D {1:MULTICHOICE:=Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A line with a slope.~A curve}

c) Calculate and draw the Bending Moment Diagram (BMD) on paper and identify the following values:

Bending moment at A.

{1:NUMERICAL:=-270:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

Bending Moment at B.

{1:NUMERICAL:=-123:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

Bending Moment at C.

{1:NUMERICAL:= 0:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

Bending Moment at D.

{1:NUMERICAL:= 0:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

From the drop down menus below indicate how the indicated points are connected in the BMD

1) A and B {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~=A line with a slope.~A curve}

2) B and C {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A line with a slope.~=A curve}

3) C and D {1:MULTICHOICE:=Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A line with a slope.~A curve}

generalfeedback.text:
The Equivalent Free Body Diagram for the system is shown above.

Distributed loads are equivalent to point loads acting at the midpoint of the distributed load.

Your Shear Force Diagram should look like the image shown above.

Your Bending Moment Diagram should look like the image shown above. It is the integral of the SFD
